author: remm
msg: - My own view on the Comet API extensions. The main differences are:
* remove robustness checks (I believe they are not useful, as they have a performance cost, only handle the most
evident "issues", and even for those evident "issues" are most likely arbitrary)
* very simple calls and no additional data structures exposed to the end user
* merge write notifications mode with non blocking; non blocking is never configured in an explicit way
* most likely backwards compatible with Comet from Tomcat 6.0
- No actual connector updates yet (for APR, the main change is to do timeout handling using Java, which is overdue).
